cardText: All songs written by Mark Knopfler Published by Hornall Bros Music Ltd / Will D Side Ltd
Mark's seventh studio album was released worldwide in 2012 worldwide, except for the US, where it was released the following year.
The sixth solo studio release from Mark Knopfler.
Mark's fifth solo studio album featured two singles: ‘True Love Will Never Fade’ and ‘Punish The Monkey’.
Mark's live EP from 2005 was recorded in one take at Shangri-La Studios in Malibu, CA.
This EP, released in 2005, features tracks from the full length release Shangri-La.

Mark's fourth solo studio album was his first release after a motorcycle accident in 2003. The first single was 'Boom, Like That' about the entrepreneurial skills of Ray Kroc. It also featured a second single, 'The Trawlerman's Song'.

The Ragpicker's Dream is Mark's third solo studio album. It features a bonus disc that contains three tracks recorded live at Shepherds Bush Empire, London, UK, (1,2, and 5) and two from Massey Hall, Toronto, ON (3 and 4). The first single from the album was 'Why Aye Man'.
Mark's second solo album was released in 2000. The UK version of this album is the only one on which 'One More Matinee' appears while 'Do America' doesn't appear on the continental European release.

Mark's first solo studio album came after composing a string of successful film soundtracks. Golden Heart featured three hit singles: 'Rudiger', 'Cannibals', and 'Darling Pretty', which was featured on the Twister film soundtrack. The album also featured guest artists The Chieftans.
This live album sees Mark team up with Emmylou Harris. It was recorded at the Gibson Amphitheater in California and features an accompanying DVD of the performance.
This collaborative album features tracks penned and performed by Mark and Emmylou Harris. The album produced two singles: ‘This Is Us’ and ‘Beachcombing’.

Mark's landmark collaboration with guitar legend Chet Atkins went one to win two Grammy Awards in 1990: Best Country Collaboration with Vocals for the song, ‘Poor Boy Blues’ and Best Country Instrumental Performance for the song, ‘So Soft, Your Goodbye’.

cardTittle: Missing… Presumed Having A Good Time
cardText: This album is by Mark's side project The Notting Hillbillies.
